summary.para: Retrieves a value that indicates session information. For example, the session flag can indicate whether the user is the inviter or the invitee.
Retrieves a value that indicates session information. For example, the session flag can indicate whether the user is the inviter or the invitee.
Retrieves a pointer to a BSTR that contains the Windows Messenger contact name.
Retrieves a pointer to a BSTR that contains the Windows Messenger contact name.
Retrieves a value that indicates the session state.
Retrieves a value that indicates the session state.
Sends the context data to the remote RendezvousApplication.

param.name: bstrData
param.para: A BSTR specifying context data for the application.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The context data was sent successfully.
The context data passed to the method is not valid.
There is not enough memory available to send the context data.

param.name: hr
param.para: The HRESULT from the application termination.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Exposes methods that send data about the session and that can terminate it.

remarks.para: The instant messaging (IM) application implements this interface and passes the object that implements IRendezvousSession and supports the DRendezvousSessionEvents connection point.
The Windows Remote Assistance application calls IRendezvousSession-> to retain the session after the call to SetRendezvousSession completes.
The Windows Remote Assistance application calls IRendezvousSession-> when the session is complete.
